course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Laboratory for General Biology I
course.description: This is a practical course accompanied by the lecture course LIFS 1901. It provides students with some basic concepts and some hands-on experience in biological investigation within the areas covered by LIFS 1901. The emphasis is on the understanding and application of the scientific principles underlying the experimental designs and procedures. Graded P or F. For students in their first, second year of study; or third or fourth year students with instructor's approval.
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1x Biology, a passing grade in AL/AS Biology

reviews.author: mading18
reviews.title: Easy course, but not worth just one credit
reviews.comment_content:
5 labs will be taught. Each lab session is comprised of 2 days spanning 2 weeks: an experimentation day and a tutorial/quiz day.
1: Using basic biology instruments
2: Basics of using a microscope
3: Cell permeability/osmosis
4: Plant pigment analysis and plant cells
5: Nucleic acid isolation

All of these labs, apart from the nucleic acid isolation task, were likely taught to you during your high school (if you did something like IB or A levels); the general content itself is pretty easy to follow and understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No offense to Professor Hung, but his talking after 30-40 minutes can get extremely boring. While he does explain the labs clearly and slowly step-by-step, I can tell a lot of people after the 40 minute mark start to lose attention, and by 1 hour half the class has fallen asleep. A lot of things he states in both the lab explanation and the tutorial will be useful in both writing the lab reports and completing the quizzes, so try your best to pay attention.

Groups of 2 students are assigned to 1 TA each. My TA (not going to state any names) was very attentive of what we did while giving us clear instructions and advice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Graded P/F, so it's pretty hard to "fail" this course if you really commit to working hard.

Apparently because a lot of people in my class didn't do very well writing lab reports or answering quiz questions, the policy of passing/failing certain assignments was changed this year:

Basically, a pass is 5 or above out of 10, and a fail is below 5

There is a certain level of tolerance to individual assessments; which there are 11: 5 quizzes, 5 lab reports, and the skills test.
You are allowed to fail a maximum of 1 assignment(number of failed assignments is 0 or 1). If you fail around 2-4 assignments, the instructors will allow you to take a remedial exam once all your other exams have been finished; this remedial exam is comprised of all the lab content taught in this course. If you pass the remedial exam, regardless of how many assignments you failed(apart from the skills test), you pass the course.

If you fail the skills test, you fail the course regardless; no redo's. The skills test is pretty easy though (mostly pipetting skills and microscopy analysis) so no issue there.

My score: P (obviously)
reviews.comment_workload:
You have to write a lab report every time there is a lab, and that lab is usually due only a couple days after the lab was held(meaning you have to complete the lab report as soon as possible regardless of whatever you have due in those next few days). This is because Hung will use students lab reports as the basis for the next week's tutorial and quiz(also a quiz every two weeks, which covers all content taught in the lab).

You don't have to memorize everything in the labs for the lab quizzes; the quizzes are all open book and generally last the entire period of class from the end of the tutorial(which on average is 2-2.5 hours). So you'll have ample time to search, read, answer, and check your responses.

reviews.author: maxcht
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus for this year fall semester:
Course introduction
Lab 1: Use of basic instruments (Experiment)
Lab 1: Use of basic instruments (Post-lab tutorial & Quiz)
Lab 2: Basic microscopy (Experiment)
Lab 2: Basic microscopy (Post-lab tutorial & Quiz)
Lab 3: Cell permeability & osmosis (Experiment)
Lab 3: Cell permeability & osmosis (Post-lab tutorial & Quiz)
Lab 4: Plant leaves & pigments (Experiment)
Lab 4: Plant leaves & pigments(Post-lab tutorial & Quiz)
Lab 5: Nucleic acid isolation (Experiment)
Lab 5: Nucleic acid isolation (Post-lab tutorial & Quiz)
Lab-skill test
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr Hung provides a lot of useful information for us to write the lab report. However, he used a lot of time for introduction and post-lab tutorial, which makes the lesson quite boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail
Assessment task:
Lab report
Quiz
Lab-skill test
I think it is quite simple to pass the tasks. Originally, students must pass all assessment tasks to pass this course. However, as quite a number of students got a fail in lab report or quiz, Dr Hung changed the passing condition. Students can still get a pass if they only got fail in one task. If they fail in more than one task, they have to attend an exam in the final exam period in order to get a chance to pass this course. Please note that students must pass the lab-skill test.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not very high. You have to do a lab report once in two weeks. For the quiz and lab report, you can have a quick review on the lab manual as the quiz is open book.

reviews.author: CuteDuck
reviews.title: Super ez course
reviews.comment_content: This is a practical course accompanied by the lecture course LIFS 1901. It provides students with some basic concepts and some hands-on experience in biological investigation within the areas covered by LIFS 1901. The emphasis is on the understanding and application of the scientific principles underlying the experimental designs and procedures. Graded P or F.
reviews.comment_teaching: All step will be tonight by TA in a very detail way, if u have any question, feel free to ask the instructor freely during or after lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: Good, I think if u have join all experiment lesson and listen the teacher, you will get a pass easily

reviews.author: severus
reviews.comment_content:
Lab 1: Use of basic instruments
Lab test on skills of use of basic instruments

Lab 2: Basic microscopy
Lab test on skills of use of microscope

Lab 3: Cell permeability & osmosis

Lab 4: Plant leaves & pigments

Lab 5: Nucleic acid isolation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Eugene will post a supplementary document of background information about the experiment. It will be helpful for writing lab reports to explain why you obtain your results.

He, on one occasion, had asked a random student to answer a question during his demostration that can be only answered if she had read the document.

He will demostrate how to perform the experiments. I did not pay much attention since you will have to read through the procedures anyways as you do your experiment.

Please come to lab sessions on time. He does not like that students enter the lab as he is explaining the procedures and worries that you may not understand what is going on.

Your TA will be there to help you solve your difficulties (eg. I could not see the cell pellets in my tube, but my TA could. She even helped complete the experiment since my labmate and I could not see the pellet at all) and even check whether you have written your lab report correctly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail. Easy grade.

- Attendance
- Lab Reports
- 2 lab tests

The lab tests are not difficult at all since the TA will supervise and warn you if you do anything wrong.
reviews.comment_workload:
We are required to come every two weeks and write a lab report for each lab session.

Lab report is not difficult to write since you can ask your TA to ask how to explain your correct or incorrect results.

reviews.author: Ching Nam
reviews.comment_content:
This syllabus is only for online and mixed teaching modes only. For face-to-face teaching mode, please refer to other reviews.

Syllabus for this year fall semester:
Course introduction
Lab 1: Use of basic instruments (Demonstration)
Lab 1: Use of basic instruments (Quiz & Discussion)
Lab 2: Basic microscopy (Demonstration)
Lab 2: Basic microscopy (Quiz & Discussion)
Lab 3: Cell permeability & osmosis (Demonstration)
Lab 3: Cell permeability & osmosis (Quiz & Discussion)
Lab 4: Plant leaves & pigments (Demonstration)
Lab 4: Plant leaves & pigments(Quiz & Discussion)
Lab 5: Nucleic acid isolation (Demonstration)
Lab 5: Nucleic acid isolation (Quiz & Discussion)

You can go back to school to do the lab after the quiz if you want to do so, but marks will not be counted.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is very detailed, and also talks about the important points we need to be aware when we need to perform the experiment we demonstrate. He tries to ask us some questions to make it more interactive. However, since he is speaking in a quite flat tone and a bit slow, some of the people feel sleepy after having half of the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
This year, the grading is changed to P/F as not all students are able to go to the lab. There is a quiz with 2 parts after each of the lab demonstration. The passing mark for each quiz is 10/20. (Quiz full marks = 20)
If you failed one of them, you may also take a remedial quiz. (The same as the one you failed) Since I passed all the usual quiz so I don't have to do so. If you pass all the quiz or just fail one quiz and pass the remedial quiz, you will get a pass in this course.
My quiz marks:
Quiz 1: 12/20
Quiz 2: 13/20
Quiz 3: 15.5/20
Quiz 4: 12.4/20
Quiz 5: 10/20
reviews.comment_workload:
I will say is quite low for this semester, as long as you have pay attention on the demonstration lectures and mark down the important points he said (These things will be asked in the quiz!), you will have no problem passing the quizzes. You can also watch the lecture videos afterwards if you have missed some important points.
Once again, this is only applicable to online and mixed modes. For face-to-face mode, please refer to other reviews.

reviews.author: minions
reviews.comment_content:
Practical 1: Freshwater pond microbes
Practical 2: Cell permeability & osmosis
Practical 3: Plant leaf& pigments
Practical 4: Nucleic acid isolation
Group project: Optimizing growth conditions for a freshwater unicellular algae
Lab skill test: use of microscope
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂都幾悶，但佢幾nice，佢會嘗試認識下同記住佢嘅學生。而且佢比分算鬆手
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab skill tests : Pass or Fail
Lab reports 50%
Final Exam 50%
如果lab report認真做/寫好長，自然會高分
final就要背熟佢比嘅notes，因為基本上全部考嘅內容都直接系notes度抽出來
overall 85%左右 A+
reviews.comment_workload: workload非常大，total寫左5份lab report，差唔多個個星期都要交一份，而且最尾仲要溫final，但事前完全唔知佢會點出，總之就完全唔似1cred嘅course，比起其他3cred嘅course仲大workload

reviews.author: 23V
reviews.title: Too much work for a 1-credit course
reviews.comment_content:
Four practicals and one group project included.
The course is designed to help you master basic skills required in biology lab such as the use of microscope, pipettes, centrifuge. Some of the experiments are quite tedious and not well-designed to give reasonable results.
reviews.comment_teaching: Hung is better at teaching practical than theory from my personal perspective. He gives a lot of hints during the lab session which are helpful for writing lab report and understanding the principles underlying the experiment. So make sure you don't miss anything he said in class. Our TA is useful at some point though he sometimes makes things even more confusing and complex when he tries to explain the procedure.
reviews.comment_grading: above 85% in total ends up with an a plus
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is heavier than expected for a one credit course. The lab reports cost quite a lot of time if you want to get a high score. You need to include a thorough explanation for your own results and the expected results. Reading the lab manual ahead is quite important, it makes you more efficient and confident when carrying out the experiment. Make sure you revise all the lab reports and instruction papers before the final, or else you will screw up really bad.

reviews.author: LeaveSoon
reviews.title: So so grade
reviews.comment_content:
Course Introduction
Practical 1: Freshwater Pond Microbes
Practical 2: Cell permeability & osmosis
Practical 3: Plant leaves & pigments
Practical 4: Nucleic acid isolation
Group project: Optimizing growth conditions for a freshwater unicellular algae
reviews.comment_teaching:
In the beginning of each lab, Prof Hung mentioned a little about the Practical pdf and showed some of the steps of the experiment.
Most of the time (or nearly all) you would rely your TA for help.
Prof Hung wouldn't teach about what makes up a good lab report as if he assumed that you should know it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab skill tests (Pass/Fail)
[Failure in any one skill test will result in failure in this course]
Test 1: Individual test of skills in microscope use
Test 2: Individual test of skills in micropipettor & microcentrifuge use

Lab reports 50%
Final Exam 50%

For final exam, questions were mainly based on the lab reports.

My score: 6X/100, got B-
reviews.comment_workload:
For a 1 credit course I think the workload is rather heavy.
Cause the lab report is a bit time-consuming.

reviews.author: KyleCheung
reviews.comment_content: Boring experiments. It is about the usage of different apparatus
reviews.comment_teaching: He is good if you are a local student. His explanation is not very clear. I have to ask TA for every step. The return of the reports is at the end of the semester so he didn't explain any of them. You will never know why your marks are deducted.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly reports are necessary. Time costs more than 1 credit. It is an individual report. I think it takes 2-3 hours to surf the web and finish it.

reviews.author: Esther_wtl
reviews.title: Not easy if you do not have a biology background
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite wide
The topics is fun ,and lot of video the watch during the lesson which is good
You can easily find more content online
reviews.comment_teaching:
All of them can explains the lecture clearly, but it is some how boring .
the lecture doesn't count attendance, but they'll count bonce point if you answer question during the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: The exam is not easy, even you study biology before. So if you are not a LIFS student I don't suggest you to take this course
reviews.comment_workload:
There is very light workload to be honest ,but the final exam required quite a bit of time to study as the content is wide.
There is an essay to submit, the essay is not hard the do, just need couple hours is enough
Also there are online quiz to finish after every lesson ,the quiz is easy, but remember to do it!!

reviews.author: I love ust <3<3
reviews.title: In Eugene we trUST
reviews.comment_content:
成個course要做4個practical, 每次做之前Prof都會demonstrate一次同埋會寫啲instructions喺白板到,跟住嚟做就得。正常係一個禮拜做一個。
做完4個practical之後會有份group project, 今年嘅係俾樽液體你要你搵返入面裝嘅係咩microbes. 做咩實驗、實驗流程全部都由自己design, 有唔明嘅地方可以問Prof/TAs.
啲實驗都幾有趣 :o)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Eugene(Instructor)好nice, 教得又好, 每次做實驗之前都會俾一份極之詳細嘅instruction你讀, 做實驗、寫lab report、溫mt final都係靠嗰份instruction, 讀熟就得。另外做實驗時有咩問題都可以去搵Eugene, 佢係香港人嚟，除左講instruction其餘時間用廣東話問佢嘢佢都會用廣東話答返你 :)
另外skill test佢都好鬆手下，做到=滿分，就算fail左一次都可以喺落堂後做返次，做到嘅話一樣都係滿分。
不過佢份人比較長氣，啲instructions/emails基本上冇分過段，會睇得好辛苦。
reviews.comment_grading:
派grade幾好, 基本上below晒mean都有B range
overall 72% B-
reviews.comment_workload:
workload對於1cred嘅course嚟講算大，每個星期一做完一個實驗星期五就要交lab report. 不過midterm period會extend做兩星期交一份。
report基本上將instructions rephrase再加幾張相就得，好鍾意life science嘅可以同Eugene展開激烈討論，會高分啲。
另外project方面基本上用返之前啲practical學過嘅嘢去做返次就得，之後份report就詳細解釋返你諗住做咩、做左啲咩、做唔到啲咩同點解你要咁做就得，project份report係final後交嘅。

reviews.author: hahahahahahahah
reviews.title: EH好好人:P
reviews.comment_content: 好多實驗要做- .-詳情請參考course syllabus
reviews.comment_teaching: EH好好人，佢啲guidance俾得好足，係Email長氣咗少少lol
reviews.comment_grading:
基本上認真做lab,report skill test無難度
個test做到就10分 做唔到有得retake
就算考試衰咗都唔怕 超好grade：）
reviews.comment_workload:
一星期一份lab report..有兩個skill test
但考緊1901MT嗰個星期同埋skill test嗰幾個星期唔使交report住
但exam好多野要睇要記..

reviews.author: Ella
reviews.title: need to study hard
reviews.comment_content:
Practical 1: Freshwater pond microbes
Practical 2: Cell permeability & osmosis
Practical 3: Plant leaf& pigments
Practical 4: Nucleic acid isolation
Group project: Finding out about the microbes in the jar
Total 4 practical and 1 final group project
And there are 2 skill test, which is about using of microscope and using of micropipettor & microcentrifuge, if you pay attention during the lesson then the test is quite easy
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Hung is very nice. Whenever you send email to ask him question about the lab report and the experiment, he will reply immediately and very contented, all of our questions will be addressed. Some of the TAs are quite helpful (at least ours is helpful), he will give us advice for the procedure of the lab.
reviews.comment_grading:
Course overall: 77.6/100 (mean: 73.1)
Total is 74.37%, final grading is B
The final exam is divided as mc and short questions, if you study hard, the grade will be better, but I did't study hard.
reviews.comment_workload: Lab report once a week nearly. Having a nice teammate will help you a lot, since the ratio of the lab report is quite high.

reviews.author: Cwhm
reviews.comment_content:
4 Practical experiments
Practical 1: Freshwater pond microbes
Practical 2: Cell permeability & osmosis
Practical 3: Plant leaf& pigments
Practical 4: Nucleic acid isolation

2 Skill tests
Skills test 1: Use of microscope
Skills test 2: Use of micropipettor & microcentrifuge

1 Group project: Finding out about the microbes in the jar (around 3 lessons)

1 Peer evaluation

1 Close book final exam
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor will demonstrate the experiment at the beginning of the lesson but still have to read the introduction for having a clearer idea. TAs are helpful and willing to answer questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite heavy for a 1 credit course. A practical report has to be submitted after each experiment. For the group project, a full lab report is required.

Better read and understand all lab introduction before the final exam since most of them are short questions, vocabulary list is provided at the front page of the paper.

reviews.author: HashireKinoko
reviews.comment_content:
Total of Four experiments (group work, 4-5 student)
1. Observing fresh pond microbes
2. Observing cell permeability and osmosis
3. Extraction of green leaf pigments and observation of stoma and guard cells on leaves
4. Isolation of nucleic acid from E.Coli cells

Two Skill tests (Takes up normal lab sessions)
1--Use of microscopes
2--Use of micropipette, microcentrifuge

One group project (Last for a few lab sessions)
---Investigation of a pond microbe sample by doing experiments designed by your own group, any kind of experiments can be done as long as they are approved.

Closed notes final exam

(maybe subjected to change)
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is patient in guiding us and willing to answer questions. The TAs are helpful also. However, the lab manual usually not been paragraphed, especially the introduction part, better do some pre-lab to have a clearer idea.
reviews.comment_grading:
Graded A+ to F this semester,

Group works: Lab reports ( total 4, 5% each )----20%
                       Project ----20%
(With peer evaluation counted towards)

Individual works: Skill tests ( total 2, 10% each )----20%
                            Final exam ----40%

Attendance was not taken, yet better attend all labs as it is mainly about group work and how much do you familiar with the lab tools and experiments.
reviews.comment_workload:
As the course is now graded, the reports have to be done from scratch, to be handed in within a week after the latest experiment has been done, not filling in worksheets anymore.

On top of that, there is a group project and report to be done and it does take time, comparatively heavier workload than before.

reviews.author: MEMENTO
reviews.comment_content: The course is about learning about different laboratory tools and how to use them and conducting biology experiments.
reviews.comment_teaching: Even though there was not much lecturing in this course, the professor was very boring to me. The instructions and introductions to each lab experiments was very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: This was pass/fail grade, and if you submit each of the lab report on time and be prepared for the quiz, you will easily pass this course.
reviews.comment_workload: It was mainly about writing the lab report after the lab experiment, and it does not take long time.

reviews.author: SSAC
reviews.title: LIFS 1903
reviews.comment_content: There are total 9 lab sessions for this course. The content basically teaches you how to use basic equipment for biology labs.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor talks a little too much for introduction for each lab and review for worksheet and quiz, so you might feel a little bored. Also, TAs will give a practical session  to students.
reviews.comment_grading:
LIFS 1901 is a Pass or fail Exam.

There is a skill test after finishing all lab sessions. Very easy. All you need to do is to use autopipette, centrifuge, and microscope properly.

There is a final exam, but since it's open note, there is no big pressure.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is not much work to do for this course.
There is a worksheet for every lab session, but most of the times you can finish within the lab session.
You might also need to prepare for quiz but its not very hard.

reviews.author: Audrey
reviews.comment_content: Well prepared, contains much detail (and therefore too much to read before the lab = = ).
reviews.comment_teaching: Professors are of high quality. Some TAs may be a little shy(speak too soft) but very helpful. Demonstration well performed.
reviews.comment_grading:
just pass/fail, do not skip labs!
a quiz before each lab, and hand in lab report at the end of the lab.
reviews.comment_workload: Well a little too much material to read before the lab if you really want to understand the procedures. Form groups of 4. At least look through the material before the lab so that you get relatively good quiz marks, also that helps you to finish the lab earlier.
